Question: Which command creates a modular JAR?

What is the output?
javac -d out --module-source-path src $(find src -name "*.java")
Which option specifies module path during compilation?

What is the result?
jar --create --file app.jar -C out .
Which creates a runtime image with jlink?

What is the output?
java --module-path mods -m myapp/com.app.Main
Correct Answer: Runs Main class in myapp module

Question: Which adds a module at runtime without requires?

What is the result?
javac --module-source-path src -d out src/myapp/module-info.java src/myapp/com/app/*.java
Which option creates JAR with module version?

What is the output?
jar --describe-module --file myapp.jar
Which allows unnamed module to read named module?

What happens with automatic module name?
// JAR: my-app-1.0.jar without MANIFEST entry

What is the result?
jlink --module-path $JAVA_HOME/jmods:mods --add-modules myapp --output image
Which manifest attribute specifies automatic module name?

What is the output?
java -p mods -m myapp
Which option adds exports at runtime?
What happens with bottom-up migration?
Correct Answer: Move non-modular JARs to module path

Question:
What is the result?
jar --create --file myapp.jar --module-version 1.0 -C out .
Which creates launcher in runtime image?

What is the output?
javac -p mods --add-modules ALL-MODULE-PATH -d out src/*.java
Correct Answer: All modules on path are resolved

Question: Which is true about unnamed module?
What happens with top-down migration?

What is the result?
java --module-path mods --add-modules myapp -m myapp/com.app.Main
Which lists modules in runtime image?

What is the output?
jar --create --file myapp.jar --main-class com.app.Main --module-version 2.0 -C out .
Correct Answer: Modular JAR with main class and version

Question: Which option shows module resolution?

What happens with --patch-module?
java --patch-module myapp=patches -p mods -m myapp
Correct Answer: Patches myapp module with code from patches

Question:
What is the result?
jlink --compress=2 --module-path mods --add-modules myapp --output image
Which specifies main class in module-info?

What is the output?
javac -d out --module-source-path "src/*" $(find src -name "*.java")
Which is true about modular JAR?
What happens with automatic module on module path?

What is the result?
jar --update --file myapp.jar --main-class com.app.NewMain
Which validates modules in image?

What is the output?
java -p mods --add-opens myapp/com.internal=ALL-UNNAMED -m myapp
Which creates exploded module directory?
What happens with requires static migration?

What is the result?
jlink --add-modules java.base --output minimal
Which lists observable modules?

What is the output?
jdeps --module-path mods -m myapp
Which allows breaking encapsulation at runtime?
What happens with multi-release JAR?

What is the result?
jar --create --file myapp.jar --release 17 -C out .
Which generates module hash?

What is the output?
java --dry-run -p mods -m myapp
Which is true about jmod files?
Correct Answer: Used at compile and link time only

Question: What happens with unnamed module reading automatic module?

What is the result?
jlink --suggest-providers java.sql.Driver --module-path mods
